title: Thotakura Pappu 👌| Side Dish | One-pot cooking 🍅 |Pigeon peas with greens
content:
Pappu recipe: Thotakura Pappu  Servings: 3 Duration: 30 minutes  A very interesting South Indian famous dal recipe with amaranth leaves we call it “Thotakura”. This dal variety made with split Pigeon peas and greens tossed with buttery fried garlic cloves, green chillies and few add ons. Actually, it’s a common side dish recipe in south India 🇮🇳 which is served with piping hot rice 🍚 and a dollop of ghee. So today I prepared easy and scrumptious Thotakura Pappu in one pot, simple to make and can’t stop eating 🙂.  Thotakura Pappu is filled with nutritious, vitamins and minerals, do try this Indian spiced dal variety 😍 I hope it’s on your to do list. Let’s start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Split Pigeon peas / Kandi Pappu- 120 gms - washed twice and add in a bowl
  • Thotakura/ amarnath leaves  - 1 bunch- washed and chopped
  • Onion - 1 small- Chopped
  • Tomatoes 🍅- 2 small - diced
  • Green chillies - 6
  • Garlic cloves - 5 - Peeled off and chopped
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Turmeric Powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Curry leaves - 6
  • Butter - 1 Tb sp
  • Water - 320 ml
Procedure:
  • Put pressure cooker On medium heated stove
  • Add butter, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, garlic cloves
  • Saute a minute and add curry leaves,chopped green chillies
  • Saute a minute and add chopped onion
  • Saute 2 mins and add turmeric powder, washed split Pigeon peas or Kandi Pappu
  • Saute more 2 minutes and add chopped tomatoes 🍅
  • Saute and add chopped Thotakura, gently mix and add water
  • Mix well and cover with lid. Let it cook for 2 whistles
  • Turn off heat and let pressure goes off
  • Open lid and add salt, combine well and serve with rice or roti 😃
  • Thotakura Pappu is ready, Enjoy!
  • Happy Cooking, have a good day ❄️🙂
